summary: The World Health Organization (WHO) is a global health leader, working to keep people healthy and safe. Founded in 1948, it's like a global doctor, helping countries with health issues and setting rules to keep everyone healthy. WHO has helped beat big diseases like smallpox and almost got rid of polio. They work on many things, like stopping HIV, malaria, and tuberculosis, and making sure people have enough to eat and a healthy workplace. They also create reports to teach us about health. The WHO is run by countries that are members and has a big budget to do its important work.
title: World Health Organization
